ingredients: 1 (10 oz) can diced tomatoes and green chilies, undrained
instructions: In a large skillet, brown the ground pork over medium heat. Drain off any excess grease.
Add the taco seasoning, diced onion,  oregano, salt, garlic, and cumin to the pork. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the onion is softened.
Stir in the refried beans and diced tomatoes and green chilies.  Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Pour a thin layer of enchilada sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Fill each tortilla with about 1/2 cup of the pork and bean mixture. Roll up tightly and place seam-down in the baking dish.
Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the enchiladas and sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot, topped with sour cream, guacamole, shredded lettuce, and black olives.
cooking_tips: If you prefer spicier enchiladas, use a hot enchilada sauce or add a pinch of chili powder to the meat mixture.
For a richer flavor, you can substitute the refried beans with homemade refried beans.
Warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave before filling to prevent them from cracking.
If you don't have taco seasoning on hand, you can make your own using the recipe provided in the context.
Don't overfill the tortillas, or they may be difficult to roll and may burst open during baking.
